meanings.definition: To pull up by the roots.
meanings.sent1: She uproots the weeds from the garden every weekend.
meanings.sent2: The storm uproots the old tree in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel uproots all the newly planted flowers.
meanings.sent4: Change uproots the familiar and plants the seeds of new beginnings.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tornado uprooting trees is etched in my mind.

meanings.sent1: The medicine uproots the virus from the body.
meanings.sent2: Efforts to uproot corruption in the system are ongoing.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's mission is to uproot all evil from the city.
meanings.sent4: Education uproots ignorance and plants the seeds of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The detective's investigation uproots the criminal's hidden activities.

meanings.definition: To displace or remove from a place or position.
meanings.sent1: The construction work uproots the residents from their homes temporarily.
meanings.sent2: The flood uproots families from their houses along the riverbank.
meanings.sent3: The magician uproots the card from the deck with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent4: A sudden job offer uproots her from her comfortable routine.
meanings.sent5: The promotion uproots him from his current department to a new team.
